title: TreeScii - ASCII Tree Generator
linkCopiedDescription: Link has been copied to clipboard

editor.placeholder: Start typing... (Supports Alt+↑↓ to move lines, Tab/Shift+Tab to adjust indent level, - to create lists)

shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts

missingDash.title: Missing Dash
missingDash.content: Each list item must start with '-'.

missingContent.content: A list item must have content after '- '.

invalidIndentation.title: Invalid Indentation
invalidIndentation.content: Indentation must be a multiple of 2 spaces.

duplicateNodeName.content: A node with the same name already exists.

emptyLine.content: The line is empty and cannot be processed.

invalidFormat.title: Invalid Format
invalidFormat.content: The ASCII tree format is incorrect.

duplicateNodeName.title: Duplicate Node Name
duplicateNodeName.content: A node with the same name already exists.

orphanNode.title: Orphan Node
orphanNode.content: The node '{node}' appears without a valid parent. This may be due to incorrect indentation or missing parent nodes.

aiDialog.checkContentReason: , adjust key descriptions as AI may not accurately capture what you want to emphasize

markdown.recommendReason: AI generates Markdown format more accurately. Direct ASCII tree generation can lead to format errors or incomplete structure
markdown.step1: 1. Copy this prompt and use it on
markdown.step1Cont: to directly get the project's Markdown list structure
markdown.step2: 2. Copy the generated Markdown structure to this tool for direct editing
markdown.promptText:
Please generate an annotated directory tree structure for GitHub project [GitHub repository link], meeting the following requirements:
1. Use Markdown unordered list format to draw the tree structure
2. Include all important files and folders (please ignore node_modules, .git, dist, build and other common system/temporary folders)
3. Add concise function description comments for each file and folder
4. Identify core files and their roles
5. Indicate main technology stack and dependencies
6. Strictly generate the tree structure based on actual repository content, do not add non-existent files or folders
7. Tree structure format example (for format reference only, do not copy the file structure):
```markdown
- Project Root/
  - file1.ext # Function description for this file
  - folder1/ # Purpose description for this folder
    - subfile1.ext # Subfile function description
    - subfolder/ # Subfolder purpose description
  - file2.ext # Function description for this file (note if it's a core file)
```

ascii.step1: 1. Copy this prompt and use it on
ascii.step1Cont: to get the project's ASCII tree structure
ascii.step2: 2. Copy the generated ASCII tree to this tool to convert it to Markdown unordered list format for easy secondary editing
ascii.promptText:
Please generate an annotated directory tree structure for GitHub project [GitHub repository link], meeting the following requirements:
1. Use ASCII characters (├ ─ │ └) to draw the tree structure
2. Include all important files and folders (please ignore node_modules, .git, dist, build and other common system/temporary folders)
3. Add concise function description comments for each file and folder
4. Identify core files and their roles
5. Indicate main technology stack and dependencies
6. Strictly generate the tree structure based on actual repository content, do not add non-existent files or folders
7. Tree structure format example (for format reference only, do not copy the file structure):
```plaintext
Project Root/
├── file1.ext      # Function description for this file
├── folder1/       # Purpose description for this folder
│   ├── subfile1.ext  # Subfile function description
│   └── subfolder/    # Subfolder purpose description
└── file2.ext      # Function description for this file (note if it's a core file)
```
